config.name: sap
config.description: This refers to the default configuration for SAP extension outbound elements.

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: Canonical name of the encoding. See Oracle's supported encodings at https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/intl/encoding.doc.html.

parameter.name: disableJcoInternalCache
parameter.description: Flag that indicates whether to use the JCo internal cache. Set this flag to true to use the SAP JCo internal cache. By default, JCo stores the metadata after the first call and populates that template in the following calls. This flag applies to both functions and sources.

parameter.name: evaluateResponseFlag
parameter.description: Flag that indicates whether to throw an exception or let the user handle it as another result. This flag is an exception or logging mechanism you use to specify whether a message throws an exception (E) or is treated as a result with a warning (W). If you set the flag to true and an E message is returned, an exception is thrown with that message. If W is returned, a warning message is logged.

parameter.name: logTraceFlag
parameter.description: Flag that indicates whether to log the trace on the Mule server. Set this to true to log a trace.

parameter.name: useSAPFormat
parameter.description: Parameter added to support the Mule 3 format for returning SAP values. Used to parse a JCoField. If set to true, values are returned as strings with the original SAP format. If set to false, values are converted to the corresponding Java objects, serialized, and returned.

parameter.name: useSAPFormatOnFunctionListener
parameter.description: Parameter added to support the Mule 3 format for returning SAP values. Used to parse a JCoField. If set to true, values are returned as strings with the original SAP format. If set to false, values are converted to the corresponding Java objects, serialized, and returned.

connection.name: certificate
connection.description: This connection provider relies on an X509 certificate to authenticate the user.

parameter.name: systemNumber
parameter.description: Two-digit system number (sysnr) of the SAP system

parameter.name: client
parameter.description: Three-digit client number. Leading zeroes are preserved if they appear in the number.

parameter.name: destinationName
parameter.description: Connector generates an identifier of the destination. If none is set, then a random value is created.

parameter.name: language
parameter.description: Connector uses a language code that determines the code page used for communicating between the SAP Adapter and the application server.

parameter.name: extendedProperties
parameter.description: Connector uses this to pass in all the database server-specific connection parameters.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: Path to the X.509 certificate. This is required when the connector is working as a client.

parameter.name: applicationServerHost
parameter.description: Host of the SAP application server

parameter.name: messageServer
parameter.description: Configuration for message server usage

parameter.name: traceFromServerFlag
parameter.description: Enable or disable RFC trace on the server

parameter.name: cpicTracingLevel
parameter.description: Enable or disable CPIC trace on the server

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

connection.name: kerberos
connection.description: This connection provider implements the Kerberos protocol to authenticate and authorize the user.

parameter.name: destinationName
parameter.description: Connector generates an identifier of the destination. If none is set, then a random value is created.

parameter.name: language
parameter.description: Connector uses a language code that determines the code page used for communicating between the SAP Adapter and the application server.

parameter.name: extendedProperties
parameter.description: Connector uses this to pass in all the database server-specific connection parameters.

parameter.name: messageServer

parameter.name: traceFromServerFlag

parameter.name: cpicTracingLevel
parameter.description: Enable or disable CPIC trace on the server

parameter.name: krb5ConfFilePath
parameter.description: The path to the krb5.conf file.

parameter.name: keytabPath
parameter.description: The path to the keytab file.

parameter.name: gssLibraryPath
parameter.description: The path to the gss library.

parameter.name: principal
parameter.description: Principal the connector uses to log in to SAP.

parameter.name: clientSncPartnerName
parameter.description: The jco.client.snc_partnername property

parameter.name: clientSncMyName
parameter.description: The jco.client.snc_myname property

parameter.name: serverSncPartnerName
parameter.description: The jco.server.snc_partnername property.

parameter.name: serverSncMyName
parameter.description: The jco.server.snc_myname property

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

connection.name: simple-connection-provider
connection.description: This connection provider connects using a username and password.

parameter.name: systemNumber
parameter.description: Two-digit system number (sysnr) of the SAP system

parameter.name: client
parameter.description: Three-digit client number. Leading zeroes are preserved if they appear in the number.

parameter.name: destinationName
parameter.description: Connector generates an identifier of the destination. If none is set, then a random value is created.

parameter.name: language
parameter.description: Connector uses a language code that determines the code page used for communicating between the SAP Adapter and the application server.

parameter.name: extendedProperties
parameter.description: Connector uses this to pass in all the database server-specific connection parameters.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: Username the connector uses to log in to SAP.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password associated with the login username

parameter.name: applicationServerHost
parameter.description: Host of the SAP application server

parameter.name: messageServer
parameter.description: Configuration for message server usage

parameter.name: traceFromServerFlag
parameter.description: Enable or disable RFC trace on the server

parameter.name: cpicTracingLevel
parameter.description: Enable or disable CPIC trace on the server

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

extension.name: SAP
extension.description: Class that has an overall configuration for the SAP extension.

operation.name: asyncRfc
operation.description:
This operation executes a BAPIFunction over a queued Remote Function Call (qRFC).
A qRFC is an extension of a transactional RFC (tRFC) that ensures that individual steps are processed in sequence. This guarantees that multiple logical unit of work (LUW) transactions are processed in the order specified by the application. tRFC can be serialized using inbound and outbound queues, hence the name queued RFC.

qRFC is best used for:
  • Extension of the Transactional RFC
  • Defined processing sequence

qRFC is recommended if you want to guarantee that several transactions are processed in a predefined order.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Name of the function to execute

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: BAPIFunction to execute

parameter.name: transactionId
parameter.description: ID that identifies an RFC so it runs only once

parameter.name: queueName
parameter.description: Name of the queue where the RFC executes

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: asynchronousRemoteFunctionCall
operation.description:
This operation executes a BAPIFunction over a queued Remote Function Call (qRFC).
A qRFC is an extension of a transactional RFC (tRFC) that ensures that individual steps are processed in sequence. This guarantees that multiple logical unit of work (LUW) transactions are processed in the order specified by the application. tRFC can be serialized using inbound and outbound queues, hence the name queued RFC.

qRFC is best used for:
  • Extension of the Transactional RFC
  • Defined processing sequence

qRFC is recommended if you want to guarantee that several transactions are processed in a predefined order.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Name of the function to execute

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: BAPIFunction to execute

parameter.name: transactionId
parameter.description: ID that identifies an RFC so it runs only once

parameter.name: queueName

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy

operation.name: confirmTransactionId
operation.description: This operation confirms to the server that a transaction is successful.

parameter.name: transactionId
parameter.description: ID of the transaction to confirm

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: createTransactionId
operation.description: This operation creates a transaction ID to be used as part of future calls.

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getFunction
operation.description: This operation retrieves a BAPIFunction based on its name.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Name of the function to retrieve

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: retrieveIdoc
operation.description: This operation retrieves an IDocument based on its key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Key that contains the required information to retrieve the IDocument

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: send
operation.description:
This operation sends an IDocument to SAP over an RFC.
An RFC can be one of two types for IDocuments: 1. Transactional (tRFC): A special form of asynchronous Remote Function Call (aRFC) that ensures transaction-like execution of processing steps that were originally executed autonomously and that executes the called function module in the RFC server only once, even if the data is sent multiple times.
tRFC is an asynchronous communication method that executes the called function module in the RFC server only once, even if the data is sent multiple times.

2. Queued (qRFC): A qRFC is an extension of tRFC that guarantees that multiple LUWs are processed in the order specified by the application, using inbound and outbound queues, hence the name queued RFC.

qRFC is best used as an extension of tRFC to define a processing sequence. Both of these types have a TID handler.
The implementation of qRFC is recommended if you want to guarantee that several transactions are processed in a predefined order.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Name of the IDoc to execute

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: IDocument to execute

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: Version of the IDoc

parameter.name: transactionId
parameter.description: ID that identifies an RFC so it runs only once

parameter.name: queueName
parameter.description: Name of the queue on which the RFC executes. This applies for qRFC since each tRFC call that is processed is given a queue name by the application. A queue name and version are required for each qRFC transaction.

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: syncRfc
operation.description:
This operation executes a BAPIFunction over a Synchronous Remote Function Call (sRFC), which requires both client and server to be available for communication or data transfer and also to be available to return a result immediately after the execution.
sRFC is best used for:
  • Communication between systems
  • Communication between SAP Web Application Server to SAP GUI

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Name of the function to execute

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: BAPIFunction to execute

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: synchronousRemoteFunctionCall
operation.description:
This operation executes a BAPIFunction over a Synchronous Remote Function Call (sRFC), which requires both client and server to be available for communication or data transfer and also to be available to return a result immediately after the execution.
sRFC is best used for:
  • Communication between systems
  • Communication between SAP Web Application Server to SAP GUI

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Name of the function to execute

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: BAPIFunction to execute

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue

source.name: document-listener
source.description: This source listens for incoming IDocs.

parameter.name: gatewayHost
parameter.description: This is the name of the host running the gateway handler. SAP Gateway is a development framework used to connect non-SAP applications to SAP applications. You can configure the SAP Gateway host to be the trusted system using an RFC destination.

parameter.name: gatewayService
parameter.description: Either the name or service port for the gateway service of the SAP system

parameter.name: programID
parameter.description: SAP system program ID that is registered on the gateway. Must be unique for the given gateway.

parameter.name: connectionCount
parameter.description: This parameter indicates the number of connections to register on the gateway. If there is more than one connection, handler requests are processed in parallel. For example, if two connections are set, this will create two handler workers or threads that are going to handle requests in parallel, almost like having two sources start together.

parameter.name: idocTypeFilterRegex
parameter.description: Expression to filter all incoming IDocs by type.

parameter.name: idocTypeExtensionFilterRegex
parameter.description: Expression to filter all incoming IDocs by type extension.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Host of the message server

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The message server name or port number

parameter.name: systemId
parameter.description: The system ID of the system the message server belongs to

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: The logon group defined in ABAP which is identifying a set of application servers

parameter.name: updateInterval
parameter.description: The update time how often the list of application servers is fetched from the message server

parameter.name: iDocRenderOptions
parameter.description: IDoc Rendering options

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of beginning action that sources can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: transactionType
parameter.description: The type of transaction to create. Availability will depend on the runtime version.

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

source.name: function-listener
source.description: This source listens for incoming BAPI Functions.

parameter.name: gatewayHost
parameter.description: This is the name of the host running the gateway handler. SAP Gateway is a development framework used to connect non-SAP applications to SAP applications. You can configure the SAP Gateway host to be the trusted system using an RFC destination.

parameter.name: gatewayService
parameter.description: Either the name or service port for the gateway service of the SAP system

parameter.name: programID
parameter.description: SAP system program ID that is registered on the gateway. Must be unique for the given gateway.

parameter.name: connectionCount
parameter.description: This parameter indicates the number of connections to register on the gateway. If there is more than one connection, handler requests are processed in parallel. For example, if two connections are set, this will create two handler workers or threads that are going to handle requests in parallel, almost like having two sources start together.

parameter.name: targetedFunction
parameter.description: Filters the incoming BAPI functions by their name. The name of the function you want to receive.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Host of the message server

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The message server name or port number

parameter.name: systemId
parameter.description: The system ID of the system the message server belongs to

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: The logon group defined in ABAP which is identifying a set of application servers

parameter.name: updateInterval
parameter.description: The update time how often the list of application servers is fetched from the message server

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of beginning action that sources can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: transactionType
parameter.description: The type of transaction to create. Availability will depend on the runtime version.

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: parseWithFieldValueChecking
parameter.description: Parsing option for enabling the field value checking mechanism in accordance with the respective IDoc field metadata.

parameter.name: parseIgnoreUnknownFields
parameter.description: Parsing option for ignoring unknown fields, e.g. when parsing with older IDoc metadata.

parameter.name: parseIgnoreInvalidCharErrors
parameter.description: Parsing option for ignoring character range check errors in accordance with the declared XML specification version. If using this option invalid characters within field values are accepted although the XML document to parse may not be well-formed because it potentially contains characters not being in the valid character range.

parameter.name: parseWithoutFieldDataTypeChecking
parameter.description: Parsing option for disabling the field data type checking mechanism in accordance with the respective IDoc field metadata. Caution: This option should be used with care. Sending IDocs with illegal field contents that are violating the field's defined datatype may cause ABAP system dumps and result in unrecognized partial loss of data when later being processed in an AS ABAP system.

parameter.name: parseRefuseUnknownXMLVersion
parameter.description: Parsing option for refusing XML documents that declare to use an unknown XML specification version, i.e. a potential future XML specification version 1.2 or 2.0.

parameter.name: parseRefuseXMLVersion10
parameter.description: Parsing option for refusing XML documents that declare to use the XML specification version 1.0 or do not contain an XML declaration header.

parameter.name: parseRefuseXMLVersion11
parameter.description: Parsing option for refusing XML documents that declare to use the XML specification version 1.1.

parameter.name: parseAcceptOnlyXmlVersion10
parameter.description: Parsing option for accepting only XML documents that declare to use the XML specification version 1.0 or do not contain an XML declaration header.

parameter.name: parseAcceptOnlyXmlVersion11
parameter.description: Parsing option for accepting only XML documents that declare to use the XML specification version 1.1.

parameter.name: parseAcceptOnlyXmlVersion10To11
parameter.description: Parsing option for accepting only XML documents that declare to use the XML specification version 1.0 or 1.1 or do not contain an XML declaration header.

parameter.name: renderIDocEmptyTags
parameter.description: Rendering option for including also all empty tags in the resulting XML document.

parameter.name: renderIDocIgnoreInvalidCharErrors
parameter.description: Rendering option for ignoring character range check errors in accordance with the used XML specification version.

parameter.name: renderIDocIgnoreTagEscapeErrors
parameter.description: Rendering option for ignoring escape character errors within XML tags in accordance with the used IDocXML format.

parameter.name: renderIDocOmitXmlDeclaration
parameter.description: Rendering option for omitting the XML declaration section in the resulting XML document.

parameter.name: renderIDocOptionalEncodingDecl
parameter.description: Rendering option for writing also an optional XML encoding declaration attribute into the resulting XML document.

parameter.name: renderIDocSubstituteInvalidChars
parameter.description: Rendering option for substituting invalid characters within IDoc field values with the number sign '#' (U+0023).

parameter.name: renderIDocWithCR
parameter.description: Rendering option for inserting CR (Carriage Return) characters into the resulting XML document.

parameter.name: renderIDocWithCRLF
parameter.description: Rendering option for inserting CR+LF (Carriage Return and Line Feed) characters into the resulting XML document.

parameter.name: renderIDocWithLF
parameter.description: Rendering option for inserting LF (Line Feed) characters into the resulting XML document.

parameter.name: renderIDocWithTabsAndCR
parameter.description: Rendering option for inserting TAB and CR (Tabulators and Carriage Return) characters into the resulting XML document.

parameter.name: renderIDocWithTabsAndCRLF
parameter.description: Rendering option for inserting TAB and CR+LF (Tabulators, Carriage Return and Line Feed) characters into the resulting XML document.

parameter.name: renderIDocWithTabsAndLF
parameter.description: Rendering option for inserting TAB and LF (Tabulators and Line Feed) characters into the resulting XML document.

parameter.name: renderIDocXml10
parameter.description: Rendering option for creating an XML document compliant to the XML specification version 1.0

parameter.name: renderIDocXml11
parameter.description: Rendering option for creating an XML document compliant to the XML specification version 1.1

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Host of the message server

parameter.name: systemId
parameter.description: System ID of the SAP system

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: Port through which the connector logs in to the message server

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: Group of SAP application servers

parameter.name: router
parameter.description: SAP router string used for a system protected by a firewall
